title: [BUG] <title>
body:
### Description

In Visual Studio, adding the NuGet package SkiaSharp.Views.WindowsForms to a newly created windows forms project targeting .NET 8.0 triggers the following warning with code 1701:
`Package 'SkiaSharp.Views.WindowsForms 3.119.0' was restored using '.NETFramework,Version=v4.6.1, .NETFramework,Version=v4.6.2, .NETFramework,Version=v4.7, .NETFramework,Version=v4.7.1, .NETFramework,Version=v4.7.2, .NETFramework,Version=v4.8, .NETFramework,Version=v4.8.1' instead of the project target framework 'net6.0-windows7.0'. This package may not be fully compatible with your project.
`

Consequently, no SKGLControl is found in the toolbox.

I noticed that the compile time assembly points to (...)\.nuget\packages\skiasharp.views.windowsforms\3.119.0\lib\net462\SkiaSharp.Views.WindowsForms.dll

I also tried SkiaSharp version 2.88.9 which didn't work as well

### Target framework
.NET 8.0
I tried also .NET 6.0


### Code

Create a blank windows forms project targeting .NET 8.0

### Expected Behavior

_No response_

### Actual Behavior

_No response_

### Version of SkiaSharp

3.116.0 (Current)
